definition: to receive/to be given/to be presented with
to give as a present/to repel/to bestow an honorary title after death (old)

sentences.english: Complimentary sampler of our new cream with any $25 purchase.
sentences.chinese: 买满25元就可以获赠面霜免费试用装。

sentences.english: Enjoy a free $25 cash voucher with a purchase of two quarts of ice cream.
sentences.chinese: 惠顾两磅装雪糕两筒，可免费获赠$25现金券一张。

sentences.english: Those taking part were volunteers who were offered a limited edition copy of the photo.
sentences.chinese: 参与拍照的志愿者可获赠一份限量版照片。

sentences.english: First-time students will get one apron (one size) for free.
sentences.chinese: 第一次参加神风小厨师课程的学生可获赠围裙一条。

sentences.english: The human fetal olfactory ensheathing cells were derived from abortion, and the informed consent was obtained from the family.
sentences.chinese: 人胚胎嗅鞘细胞为流产胚胎培养，获赠者知情同意。

sentences.english: Two free copies of the IASP bi-annual Directory.
sentences.chinese: 免费获赠二册国际科技园协会半年度目录。

sentences.english: Each expert was given improved corn varieties when leaving.
sentences.chinese: 离开永顺时，每位专家均获赠了玉米良种。

sentences.english: Staying two nights get one superior room voucher for free.
sentences.chinese: 连续入住两晚即可获赠免费高级房券一张。

sentences.english: They will also be given signed Brazilian football shirts.
sentences.chinese: 他们还将获赠有球员签名的巴西队球衫。

sentences.english: Each household will receive a 200-yuan (US$29.30) public transport card commemoratingthe event as another bonus.
sentences.chinese: 每家还将获赠一张200元人民币的交通卡。

sentences.english: Recipients agree to share the offspring of gift animals with others in need.
sentences.chinese: 接受者同意将获赠牲畜的后代分送给其他需要的人。

sentences.english: A free cocktail drink or draught beer will be given to members for a minimum collection of 3 stamps.
sentences.chinese: 集齐最少三个印花可获赠生啤或鸡尾酒一杯。

sentences.english: Every participant will be given a cap as souvenir.
sentences.chinese: 各参加者均获赠大会纪念帽乙份。

sentences.english: For each consumption upto RMB 398, receive a complimentary bottle of Grace Vineyard wine.
sentences.chinese: 一次性消费满398元即可获赠怡园干红一瓶。

definition: to include (as a free gift, when buying sth)/to come with
to give a present/to accord (a favor)/to grant
abbr. for 特別優惠|特别优惠[te4 bie2 you1 hui4]/ex gratia
bond (esp. document split in two, with each party holding one half)/contract/deed (i.e. title deeds)/ticket/voucher/certificate
to draw a prize/a lottery/a raffle
